message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR 

This paper proposes a novel loss function for action spotting in soccer videos, which involves detecting human-induced events annotated with single timestamps. The paper focuses on dealing with the temporal context naturally present around an action, which suggests that it is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves testing the loss function on a large dataset of soccer videos, which suggests that it may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. The paper also involves proposing a new loss function, which suggests that it may belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Finally, the paper involves identifying challenging cases for action spotting and illustrating how the loss function can be leveraged to design a highlights generator, which suggests that it may also belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category.
